verses.verse: "If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> steals <S%H1589><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H176><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> and slaughters <S%H2873><s%> it or <S%H176><s%> sells <S%H4376><s%> it, he shall pay <S%H9608><s%> five <S%H2568><s%> oxen <S%H1241><s%> for the ox <S%H7794><s%> and four <S%H702><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> for the sheep. <S%H7716><s%>

"[But] if <S%H518><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> has risen <S%H2224><s%> on him, there will be bloodguiltiness <S%H1818><s%> on his account. He shall surely <S%H9608><s%> make <S%H9608><s%> restitution; <S%H9608><s%> if <S%H518><s%> he owns nothing, <S%H369><s%> then he shall be sold <S%H4376><s%> for his theft. <S%H1591><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> what <S%H1591><s%> he stole <S%H1591><s%> is actually <S%H4672><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> alive <S%H2416><s%> in his possession, <S%H3027><s%> whether <S%H4480><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> a donkey <S%H2543><s%> or <S%H5704><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> he shall pay <S%H9608><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> lets a field <S%H7704><s%> or <S%H176><s%> vineyard <S%H3754><s%> be grazed <S%H9059><s%> [bare] and lets <S%H7971><s%> his animal <S%H1165><s%> loose <S%H7971><s%> so that it grazes <S%H9059><s%> in another <S%H312><s%> man's field, <S%H7704><s%> he shall make <S%H9608><s%> restitution <S%H9608><s%> from the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own field <S%H7704><s%> and the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own vineyard. <S%H3754><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> a fire <S%H784><s%> breaks <S%H3318><s%> out and spreads <S%H4672><s%> to thorn <S%H6975><s%> bushes, <S%H6975><s%> so that stacked <S%H1430><s%> grain or <S%H176><s%> the standing <S%H7054><s%> grain <S%H7054><s%> or <S%H176><s%> the field <S%H7704><s%> [itself] is consumed, <S%H398><s%> he who started <S%H1197><s%> the fire <S%H1200><s%> shall surely <S%H9608><s%> make <S%H9608><s%> restitution. <S%H9608><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> or <S%H176><s%> goods <S%H3627><s%> to keep <S%H8104><s%> [for him,] and it is stolen <S%H1589><s%> from the man's house, <S%H1004><s%> if <S%H518><s%> the thief <S%H1590><s%> is caught, <S%H4672><s%> he shall pay <S%H9608><s%> double. <S%H8147><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> the thief <S%H1590><s%> is not caught, <S%H4672><s%> then the owner <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall appear <S%H7126><s%> before <S%H413><s%> the judges, <S%H430><s%> [to] determine whether <S%H518><s%> <S%H3808><s%> he laid <S%H7971><s%> his hands <S%H3027><s%> on his neighbor's property. <S%H4399><s%>

"For every <S%H3605><s%> breach <S%H6588><s%> of trust, <S%H6588><s%> [whether it is] for ox, <S%H7794><s%> for donkey, <S%H2543><s%> for sheep, <S%H7716><s%> for clothing, <S%H8008><s%> [or] for any <S%H3605><s%> lost thing about which <S%H9><s%> one says, <S%H9><s%> 'This <S%H834><s%> is it,' the case <S%H559><s%> of both <S%H2088><s%> parties shall come <S%H1697><s%> before <S%H8147><s%> the judges; <S%H935><s%> he whom <S%H5704><s%> the judges <S%H430><s%> condemn <S%H834><s%> shall pay <S%H430><s%> double <S%H7561><s%> to his neighbor. <S%H9608><s%>

"If <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> gives <S%H5414><s%> his neighbor <S%H7453><s%> a donkey, <S%H2543><s%> an ox, <S%H7794><s%> a sheep, <S%H7716><s%> or <S%H176><s%> any <S%H3605><s%> animal <S%H929><s%> to keep <S%H8104><s%> [for him,] and it dies <S%H4191><s%> or <S%H176><s%> is hurt <S%H7665><s%> or <S%H176><s%> is driven <S%H7617><s%> away <S%H7617><s%> while no <S%H369><s%> one <S%H369><s%> is looking, <S%H7200><s%>

an oath <S%H7621><s%> before the Lord <S%H3068><s%> shall be made <S%H1961><s%> by the two <S%H8147><s%> of them, that he has not laid <S%H7971><s%> hands <S%H3027><s%> on his neighbor's property; <S%H4399><s%> and its owner <S%H1167><s%> shall accept <S%H3947><s%> [it,] and he shall not make <S%H9608><s%> restitution. <S%H9608><s%>
"But if <S%H518><s%> it is actually <S%H1589><s%> stolen <S%H1589><s%> from him, he shall make <S%H9608><s%> restitution <S%H9608><s%> to its owner. <S%H1167><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> it is all torn <S%H2963><s%> to pieces, <S%H2963><s%> let him bring <S%H935><s%> it as evidence; <S%H5707><s%> he shall not make <S%H9608><s%> restitution <S%H9608><s%> for what <S%H2966><s%> has been torn <S%H2966><s%> to pieces.

"And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> borrows <S%H7592><s%> [anything] from his neighbor, <S%H7453><s%> and it is injured <S%H7665><s%> or <S%H176><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> while its owner <S%H1167><s%> is not with it, he shall make <S%H9608><s%> full <S%H9608><s%> restitution. <S%H9608><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> its owner <S%H1167><s%> is with it, he shall not make <S%H9608><s%> restitution; <S%H9608><s%> if <S%H518><s%> it is hired, <S%H7916><s%> it came <S%H935><s%> for its hire. <S%H7939><s%>

"And if <S%H3588><s%> a man <S%H376><s%> seduces <S%H6601><s%> a virgin <S%H1330><s%> who <S%H834><s%> is not engaged, <S%H781><s%> and lies <S%H7901><s%> with her, he must pay <S%H4117><s%> a dowry <S%H4117><s%> for her [to be] his wife. <S%H802><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> her father absolutely <S%H1><s%> refuses <S%H3985><s%> to give <S%H3985><s%> her to him, he shall pay <S%H5414><s%> money <S%H8254><s%> equal to the dowry <S%H3701><s%> for virgins. <S%H4119><s%>
"You shall not allow a sorceress <S%H3784><s%> to live. <S%H2421><s%>
"Whoever <S%H3605><s%> lies <S%H7901><s%> with an animal <S%H929><s%> shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put <S%H4191><s%> to death. <S%H4191><s%>
"He who sacrifices <S%H2076><s%> to any god, <S%H430><s%> other <S%H1115><s%> than <S%H1115><s%> to the Lord <S%H3068><s%> alone, <S%H905><s%> shall be utterly <S%H2763><s%> destroyed. <S%H2763><s%>
"And you shall not wrong <S%H3238><s%> a stranger <S%H1616><s%> or oppress <S%H3905><s%> him, for you were strangers <S%H1616><s%> in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

"If <S%H518><s%> you afflict <S%H6031><s%> him at all, <S%H6031><s%> [and] if <S%H518><s%> he does cry <S%H6817><s%> out to Me, I will surely <S%H8085><s%> hear <S%H8085><s%> his cry; <S%H6818><s%>

and My anger <S%H639><s%> will be kindled, <S%H2734><s%> and I will kill <S%H2026><s%> you with the sword; <S%H2719><s%> and your wives <S%H802><s%> shall become <S%H1961><s%> widows <S%H490><s%> and your children <S%H1121><s%> fatherless. <S%H3490><s%>

"You shall not delay <S%H309><s%> [the offering from] your harvest <S%H4395><s%> and your vintage. <S%H1831><s%> The first-born of your sons <S%H1121><s%> you shall give <S%H5414><s%> to Me.
